title: How many mobile phones made in the 1980s remain in working order and still in use today? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t know how many phones made in 1980’s are still in use, but I know where they would be. 2G was launched in 1991, so these 1980’s phones would be 1G analog phones. The last 1G network left is or was Skylink in two area of Russia. “Skylink, [a] subsidiary company of TELE2 Russia operates NMT-450 network as of 2016 in Arkhangelsk Oblast and Perm Krai. These networks are used in sparsely populated areas with long distance. License for the provision of services is valid until 2021” from Nordic Mobile Telephone - Wikipedia

I have a couple of old analogue mobile phones from the early 90s. Whilst both would technically work (though the batteries might not really be up to the job any more) there hasn't been an analogue network to connect them to for many, many years…
